pros: Great opportunity, great benefits, full time experience

pros: The work environment is amazing!
cons: No cons working for Wells Fargo Call Center!

pros: Coworkers, pay, benefits including paid time off
cons: Senior management, no travel, movement

review_title: Great place to work, lots of opportunities to grow, great team work...
pros: Great place to work, lots of opportunities to grow, great team work, management understands the value you bring to the team, higher management recognizes the effort and good work ethics.
cons: Fun place to work but hard get noticed by higher management.

pros: Great Salary..room for growth and opportunity
cons: Competitive atmosphere and lack of communication between corporate and main office

pros: Great company , good benefits, pay
cons: No complaints great company to work for

pros: Great work life balance and pay.
cons: No cons. The company does a great job promoting from within

pros: I learned a lot while working here. We had a great team and worked well together. Work life balance was well maintained.
cons: I don't have anything bad to say. Not much room for movement but that was because of the small department I was in.

pros: Pay, all the different shift options, benefits

pros: fair salary, great benefits, telecommuting available for some roles. strong management, fair, balanced. great development opportunities
cons: very large company so can be a lot of churn with teams, leadership re-orgs etc. but no more than other companies this size
advice_to_mgmt: Enforce compliance to standardization would save a fortune in duplicative work demanded by executives that can't deal with change or have ego issues.

pros: Great benefits, employee focused, good training for each job
cons: Salary could be higher, a Lead Teller makes almost the same as a full time teller
advice_to_mgmt: Salary should be based on experience

review_title: Great place to work, but depends on team
pros: Benefits, people are nice, decent corporate structure
cons: Technology is outdated, needs to be updated

review_title: Not the best, but not the worst.
pros: Decent benefits and most of the people working for the organization that I had to interact with were alright. The job isn't the hardest in the world either. A lot of opportunities for advancement.
cons: Though a lot has changed since the lawsuit, its still very much pushy sales focused. Under compensated for sure.

review_title: Great Team and company to work for
pros: Great Company, nice benefits, very nice paid time off
cons: Lots of upper management changes

pros: Great co workers fun people
cons: Advancement opportunities is very limited

review_title: Great pay and benefits if you can put up with the culture

cons: The culture and structure is pretty frustrating to deal with at times

review_title: Great Company and culture - overall success will depend on who your direct report is
A company of career development focus
pros: Benefits and development options are excellent
cons: It is a large company and you can get lost in all of career and department options
advice_to_mgmt: Keep focusing on Developing and encouraging your team!

review_title: Overall good company to work for
pros: Generous time off, good benefits
cons:
Poor pay, difficult to move up. Even when you do move up, HR refuses to give you a proper raise. Yet, if they hire someone from outside the company into your role, they will pay that person much more than an internal hire. Makes no sense, you'd think they would care more about retaining their current employees/talent.
Yearly merit increases never exceeded 1.75%.

review_title: Great place to work with many benefits!!
pros: good benefits; opportunity for advancement; good incentive plans
cons: None worth mentioning or worth worrying about.

pros: Promote from within, great training experience, and supportive management.
cons: None that I have ran into so far.

pros: My group was like a family. I was able to really see work life balance
cons: Listen more to your employees about being advanced / promoted.

review_title: This is a great place to work
pros: Coworkers/People are generally happy and supportive. Good benefits and pay compared to other banks.
cons: Downsizing is occurring at a rapid rate. Its difficult to transition to other parts of the bank unless you have a very strong advocate.
